storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to perform role creation to achieve tailored user access management

functional.title: Verify successful creation of a new role with unique name and assigned permissions
preconditions: Administrator is logged in with valid admin credentials
Administrator is on the Role Management section of the application
Database has existing roles table with at least 2 existing roles
Administrator has full permissions to create, modify, and delete roles

steps.action: Navigate to the Role Management section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Role Management page loads successfully displaying existing roles in a table format

steps.action: Click on the 'Create New Role' button located in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Role creation form modal opens with fields for 'Role Name' and 'Permissions' checkboxes

steps.action: Enter 'Content Manager' in the 'Role Name' text field
steps.expectedResult: Text 'Content Manager' appears in the Role Name field without validation errors

steps.action: Select permissions checkboxes: 'View Content', 'Edit Content', and 'Publish Content' from the available permissions list
steps.expectedResult: Selected checkboxes display with blue checkmarks and remain selected

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button at the bottom of the role creation form
steps.expectedResult: Form submits successfully, loading spinner appears briefly, and green confirmation banner displays message 'Role "Content Manager" created successfully' at the top of the page

steps.action: Verify the new role appears in the roles table on the Role Management page
steps.expectedResult: New row appears in the roles table showing 'Content Manager' with assigned permissions 'View Content, Edit Content, Publish Content' and creation timestamp

postconditions: New role 'Content Manager' is saved in the roles table in the database with unique role ID
Role creation activity is logged in the audit log with timestamp, administrator username, and action details
Administrator remains on the Role Management page with the modal closed
Role creation completes within 2 seconds as per performance requirements

userStoryObject.title: As Administrator, I want to perform role creation to achieve tailored user access management
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND: The need for tailored user access management arises from the diverse roles within the organization that require different levels of access to resources. CURRENT STATE: Currently, user access is managed manually, leading to potential security risks and inefficiencies. DESIRED STATE: With the implementation of role creation, administrators can efficiently manage user access based on defined roles. KEY FUNCTIONALITY: ‚Ä¢ Create new roles with specific permissions. ‚Ä¢ Modify existing roles as needed. ‚Ä¢ Delete roles that are no longer relevant. ‚Ä¢ Log all role management activities for compliance. USER INTERACTION FLOW: 1. Administrator navigates to the role management section. 2. Administrator selects the option to create a new role. 3. Administrator inputs role name and assigns permissions. 4. Administrator submits the role creation form. 5. System validates the input and creates the role. 6. Confirmation message is displayed. TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS: ‚Ä¢ Data source: Roles table in the database. ‚Ä¢ Validation rules: Ensure role names are unique. ‚Ä¢ API endpoints: POST /api/roles for role creation. ‚Ä¢ Security: Role management actions require admin authentication. ‚Ä¢ Performance: Role creation should complete within 2 seconds. OUT OF SCOPE: ‚Ä¢ Role assignment to users. SUCCESS METRICS: ‚Ä¢ 90% of roles created without errors within the first month.

Persona: Administrator (Administrator)
userStoryObject.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria 1: System allows administrators to create new roles with unique names and assigned permissions.

Criteria 2: System displays a confirmation message upon successful role creation.

Criteria 3: System logs the role creation activity for audit purposes.

Criteria 4: System prevents the creation of roles with duplicate names.
